meanings.definition: A military force composed of ordinary citizens
meanings.sent1: The local militia trained together to protect their town.
meanings.sent2: The militia was called upon to defend the country during the war.
meanings.sent3: The militia members joked about their matching uniforms.
meanings.sent4: In times of crisis, the militia stood as a shield for the community.
meanings.sent5: The image of the militia marching was etched in their minds.

meanings.definition: The whole body of able-bodied male citizens declared by law as being subject to call to military service
meanings.sent1: Every able-bodied man was part of the militia according to the law.
meanings.sent2: The militia registration process was organized and efficient.
meanings.sent3: The annual militia meeting turned into a friendly competition.
meanings.sent4: Being part of the militia was like having a duty-bound family.
meanings.sent5: The idea of the militia being ready at a moment's notice was reassuring.
